p: Furthermore, in vitro antioxidant activities of M. chamomilla extracts, along with its apigenin and apigenin-7-glycoside contents were previously characterized, with IC 50 of 18.19 ± 0.96 µg/mL, 2.0 ± 0.1 mg/g and 20.1 ± 0.9 mg/g, respectively [ 41], confirming the primary importance of apigenin in the antioxidant capacity of M. chamomilla. Moreover, free radical scavenging activity (DPPH assay) of M. chamomilla volatile oil and its major components were formerly recorded in the following order: chamazulene > α-bisabolol oxide A > chamomile EO > ( E)-β-farnesene > α-bisabolol [ 7].
